title: Understanding Weather And Climate 6th c2013 Aguado + Burt txtbk
description:
WARNING: This file, a complex PDF, is slightly broken (not fully PDF-standard compliant) and display problems (objects like graphs, figures, captions, footnotes, full pages even, not showing) will occur when viewed with Adobe Reader or Acrobat. Foxit Reader and PDF-XChange Viewer have been tested with this file and both ignore most if not all of these minor incompliances.


Understanding Weather And Climate, 6th Edition (c2013), textbook by Edward Aguado + James E. Burt.

TEXTBOOK INFO: <a href=" http://www.pearsonhighered.com/product?ISBN=0321769635" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsonhighered.com/product?ISBN=0321769635</a>

CONTENTS:
---------
PART I  ENERGY AND MASS
 1. Composition and Structure of the Atmosphere
 2. Solar Radiation and the Seasons
 3. Energy Balance and Temperature
 4. Atmospheric Pressure and Wind
PART II  WATER IN THE ATMOSPHERE
 5. Atmospheric Moisture
 6. Cloud Development and Forms
 7. Precipitation Processes
PART III  DISTRIBUTION AND MOVEMENT OF AIR
 8. Atmospheric Circulation and Pressure Distributions
 9. Air Masses and Fronts
PART IV  DISTURBANCES
 10. Mid-Latitude Cyclones
 11. Lightning, Thunder, and Tornadoes
 12. Tropical Storms and Hurricanes
PART V  HUMAN ACTIVITIES AND SPECIAL TOPICS
 13. Weather Forecasting and Analysis
 14. Human Effects: Air Pollution and Heat Islands
PART VI  CURRENT, PAST AND FUTURE CLIMATES
 15. Earth's Climates
 16. Climate Changes: Past and Future
PART VII  SPECIAL TOPICS AND APPENDICES
 17. Atmospheric Optics
 Appendix A: Unit of Measurement and Conversions
 Appendix B: The Standard Atmosphere
 Appendix C: Weather Map Symbols
 Appendix D: Weather Extremes

FILE INFO: paginated, bookmarked, true PDF (237 MB).
compressed (zipped): *right-click* the filename (.7z) & choose *Extract* to convert to PDF; discard the .7z file (container) when done with seeding.
